title: Former Minneapolis Police Officers’ Trial Begins for Allegedly Violating George Floyd’s Civil Rights
sub_head: In opening statements, defense attorneys are expected to lay the blame on Derek Chauvin, the former officer convicted of murdering Mr. Floyd
body:
The legal fallout from the May 2020 killing of George Floyd enters its next chapter Monday, when federal prosecutors will have the first opportunity to make the case that three of the former police officers who were on the scene that day should be punished for his death.
Prosecutors and defense attorneys are set to present their opening statements in the federal trial of Tou Thao, Thomas Lane and J. Alexander Kueng, who are accused of violating Mr. Floyd’s civil rights.
